ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Reading paper and develop my own thoughts based on my reading.

The format of this course (weekly guest lecture followed by weekly discussion) gave us us the opportunity to learn the background and current state of a panoply of different areas across multiple disciplines within neuroscience from instructors who were experts in those fields. Having each lecturer join us for discussion was a great way for us to bounce around and test ideas we developed from weekly readings. My favorite course as an INP student so far.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I hope to learn more about computational neurosciences (encoding and decoding) and developmental neurosciences.

Strengths: I absolutely loved the lecture portion of the course. It was a terrific way for us to learn about the state of a particular field from an expert. I also appreciated the requirement that guest lecturers refrain from discussing their own research so that more emphasis could be placed on the status of the field overall rather than the minutia of a single PIs current research interests. Weaknesses: I wish we had more time to discuss our opinions about each paper during weekly discussions, rather that simply summarizing figures and discussing techniques and major findings. It might be useful for each lecturer to pick an exemplary paper along with suboptimal papers they deem substandard. Although the flaws of some papers were glaringly obvious, for some fields to which I had limited or no prior exposure, it would have been helpful to learn what a model paper for that field looks like. Weekly feedback on our papers was mostly helpful but sometimes felt contrived and forced.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I'd like to recommend the course. One can learn a lot about many aspects of neurosciences.
Absolutely. Principles of Neuroscience was a unique and engaging way to survey a wide array of distinct fields within neuroscience.
